DOC.brief_summary: Vitamin D deficiency occurs in around 50% of our transplant population. Preventive treatment with Vitamin D (D-cure) can reduce the prevalence of Bronchiolitis Obliterans Syndrome after lung transplantation
DOC.brief_title: Vitamin D in Bronchiolitis Obliterans Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: - Prospective, interventional, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial. - Clinical setting (tertiary University Hospital). - Investigator-driven, no pharmaceutical sponsor. - Lung transplant recipients. - Add-on of study-drug (placebo or vitamin D) to 'standard of care' (standardized, routine immunosuppressive and infectious prophylactic protocol). - 1:1 inclusion ratio (placebo:Vitamin D). - Randomisation at discharge after informed consent.
DOC.criteria: Stable LTx recipients at discharge after transplantation. Signed informed consent Adult (age at least 18 years old at moment of transplantation) Able to take oral medication Prolonged and/or complicated Intensive care unitcourse after transplantation. Early (<30 days posttransplant) postoperative death Major suture problems (airway stenosis or stent) Retransplantation (lung) Previous transplantation (solid organ) Multiorgan transplantation (lung+ other solid organ)
